string.text: How can there be anything new here? Think of this as kindergarten, preschool even. Granted, if you don't hang around here, you'll get sacked in five minutes in the Zone, so there. The smart ones stay here a while, and then they go the devil knows where. Besides, you can make it here with ammo or weapons, there's no question about it. Everyone does it.

All I have to do is wait for those pansies in uniform to go out for lunch... There's no point to hang out here, I need to go to the Big Land, but they won't let me, no matter what. I'm not the only one trying to get out either, but still we can't slip by them yet.

Not far from here the fellows in uniform needed something. They didn't used to come here - cleared everything out spick-n-snap before me, right down to cutting down the cables. And now it seems they found... I couldn't get even close to the building - they noticed me right away and started shooting. Glad I made it out without a hold in my hide.
Nothing. Trying to make it, that's all.

We're getting together a team of those who can't get enough of climbing underground in the Zone. There's an old factory, and under it there are all these powerlines. They say there's a bunch of goodies there, always something new to check out. Very interesting...
Not new - old! They say that Strelok's old base used to be located here. I wonder what kind of traces one could find from that time, if they really looked hard?
Can you believe it - an hour ago I almost got into a mess! I was here half a year ago - peace and quiet, but now these razorheads in their outfits under every bush! It's crazy, man...

You're lucky, stalker, that the bandits didn't get you: they have a base pretty close to here. Oh how I would have totaled it if I could... but for now we're just observing. This is their supporting base - the headquarters are located closer to the center of the Zone.

They say there used to be an impressive lab here, camouflaged. Oh...On the one hand it'd be great to find the entrance - I bet there are lots of goodies inside. On the other hand, it gives me the heebie-jeebies...

Did you know that in what's now the Dark Valley, before the catastrophe there used to be an underground scientific research complex? I don't know what it was meant for, but I'm sure nothing good. They say different things about it, but mostly it's bad. Terrible thing.

And so what? What do you want to hear? I'll tell you this much: "dutiers" are definitely the cops, but they know how to keep the order, that's for sure. But overall I don't like them very much. They're like the landlords everywhere - don't take this, don't carry that out of the Zone...Not only that, but they've already determined what you're allowed to say in the Big Land and what you're supposed to be hush-hush about! They blab, and actually want to destroy the Zone, little by little. Well that doesn't surprise me, coming from former soldiers....they're all dreamers. What's worse is that, they say, their support comes all the way from the top.

This territory is now controlled by the Duty, and the rules of the Duty are the law of the land. We control the borders of the zone and cool off hot heads: the poor fools come here in whole caravans, amateurs, romantics...and then die off in groups on the very first day.

Were you at our half-way camp? Granted, it's not just ours - you can run into most anyone here. What's important is that it's a good place, without any trash, and all the news about the Zone drain in here. You can almost always hear something useful, or at least chat with folks about nothing in particular. Too bad that Baldy with his group left the day before yesterday - so this time I didn't even get to see him.

Head to camp, you'll hear all the rumors there. All who are doing this for the first time - the rookies like you - usually drop by to pick up some pointers or rest a while. There are soldiers standing nearby: don't be too afraid of them, but don't get in their way either - they can shoot and not think twice about it...Here by the trader - well, the retailer of the local merchandise - there's a nice, calm little place where you can break camp.

Right now, stalker, this place is safe, and we're trying to keep it that way. There are many people here: some who've made it their home and don't go beyond the surrounding area, others who are preparing for yet another raid. Such a shame that Irokez didn't come back. He loved to set rookies like yourself on the way of the righteous.

Did you hear that the Duty has announced that it's recruiting new members? I thought about it a minute, but then decided - the hell with it. Before long they'll draft me...Don't need that kind of discipline. I served my two years, and that was enough for me...
If you haven't heard yet, I'm letting you know: we're recruiting new members. If you have some experience, come, you won't regret it. At the base ask for Petrenko.

Did you come to look at the matches too - want to place a bid or something? Well what do you know! There's an arena here somewhere, and you're a total zero! So check this out: members of the Duty squad catch mutants, right? After the research, if the beasts are still alive, they let them loose on the arena. And these babes come in all shapes and sizes - some, you'll look at them and die laughing, others - you'll wet your pants.

They just provided the arena with new meat. Entertainment for the people, and for us a good way to earn a few percent from the bids. We'll prove to the stalkers that the Duty isn't just wagging its tongue, but that we do the real thing.

Hey listen, have you been to the Rostok? It used to be quiet there, but now it's tough going there alone - your average wild field, much too many mutants there now. Let's go together, what do you say?...On the other hand...I don't know you, and you don't know me. What if...Yeah, dude, sorry, forget i mentioned it.
We're just back from Rostok. You don't need to show your face there, especially if you're alone. Want to stay alive? Then you better not go.

Well I was thinking of going to Yantar, but then thought, screw it. There the eggheads set up a full-fledged scientific base in the Zone. They're digging around in the devil knows what while zombies are romping all around outside the complex. How idyllic, my goodness.

They were purging the Yantar zone recently...yeah, cleaned it up pretty well! There are research laboratories there, but too many zombies all around. So we have to regularly haul over there to help the scientists out.

By the old forgotten construction site, you know - the Freedom base. They're happy fellows, have some soul; it's such a pleasure to chat with them over a bottle of wine. And Duty isn't there all the time like around the bar.

There's an old factory nearby, and we keep on cleaning it of bandits, and each time they come back again! It hasn't even been a month since last time, and they're already back. You better be more careful there...
Freedom is hiding out behind the old construction site...break them all down I say...
Leave before it gets dark! During the day it's more or less okay, but once the sun sets...
Stalker, you should leave now! We're going to take down the cordoning. We keep it up only during the day, and leave for the night - it's too creepy here at night.
You see, during the night you need to keep yourself hidden, and preferable behind a good set of doors. During the dark part of the day we find ourselves basically under seige.
Well buddy, it seems you're not up to date? During the night you have to snooze somewhere far away from here. Here during the night even a granade launcher doesn't always help.
You know what, let the Duty guys and the Freedom guys and the marauders figure out who this part belongs to. What is it to me? To hell with it all...
We're working here now, stalker. Not only is there a bunch of these wretches breeding here, but also those asses the mercs and the retards from the Freedom faction get in the way...

I have to warn you that it's not very safe here even during the day. Once in a while there is a shoot-off, as far as I understand, theirs is some long-standing conflicts between the various local bandit factions.

Listen, why don't you tell me - this is our territory, right? It's easier for us to hold off the wretches that come here from the center of the Zone, isn't it? The eggheads can mess around trying to figure out who's bothering them, but the Duty and the marauders can get the hell out of here.

And you don't know? They created a new path to get past the Duty patrol right to the perimeter with all the goods. Get there from Yantar, and then use the back alleys all the way to Agroprom - and you're there!

Nothing. I don't know squat. I grab a bite here and there, trying to make enough for my daily bread. It's too creepy going into the Zone itself - to hell with it. And there's no work at home, my wife's on my case - gotta live somehow. Here in the zone, if you look around for a day, you can get some artifacts together. And it'll do for your bread and butter.
And why are you here? Planning to go to Yantar, or are you trying to sneak some artifacts past a brother?

I won't conceal the fact that here your stalker colleagues offer us from time to time some quite interesting anomalous formations - artifacts is what you call them. Because of...shall we say...the uncertain level of control over them...these places form a kind of highly active smuggling trail.

What's wrong with you man? We laid a path just so that we wouldn't have to run into the fellows from the Duty faction if we wanted to get to the Big Land for something. Though they still hang around here from time to time, at least they don't know anything for now and so you can get around them.

I'm just back from Yantar. Thought I'd pass something off to science as usual, but they're all locked in their bunkers, don't go out even during the day, if only to another chopper. So if you're planning to head in that direction, might as well change course...
There is research going on in the Yantar zone, but recently there's been more zombies that are hanging around those parts. So we're defending the entrances.

I don't even know what to tell you. I wanted to get back into our complex - it's called Yantar, as you probably know. And here there's this: they say that while before it was just plain dangerous, now it's simply impossible to get through. Maybe they're exaggerating?

I was at Yantar, the science is completely dead there: sneaking around, hiding...They're living only off of the supplies the spinners drop off. On the other hand, there really are a lot of zombies there now. If you spend a week living there among them, you'll start sneaking around yourself. That's the kind of place it is. Not very pleasant.
To the dogs with him. Who does he think he is to be hanging out with zombies?! So many of them in the stupid "cavern" - and they keep on coming!
We're trying to stop the movement of zombies from the underground. Honestly, I totally wouldn't mind if you joined - we have a shortage of men...
You know, we're also gathering various data..For instance, I'm researching the main ways in which the quasi-lives...that is, zombies according to your terminology...spread.

Yeah that's about it...Some feed off the Garbage, collecting little junk, others penetrate deeper into the Zone. Naturally, there you can find much better items, but not everyone will want to go there. That's no place for rookies, and if you don't have any ammo, don't even think about going there - it's a lost cause.
Did you get to shoot at the zombies running around the depths? Well you better watch it - they're not afraid of anything, don't feel any pain, in other words, wretches without any brains.

I'm going to apply for a position in the underground! Hey man, relax - I'm kidding. You know that if you wander into these parts, you're as good as dead. Best case scenario, you'll turn into a zombie.
I'm warning you: don't go into the underground labyrinth. Well, if you really want to go then go, I won't hold you back by force. Just that they don't come back from there alive.

You see, I would like to warn you. You shouldn't go into the caverns. Nobody, in fact, should go there: it's linked to major alterations in the psychology and metabolism of an individual, and, I'm afraid, these affects are not reversible.

There! Now I'm going to...enlighten you...basically save your life. Don't go down there! People disappear there, and then at times come back to haunt you at night. Only these aren't some vampire horror stories, but the real truth about zombies. That's how it is.

Have you seen our smartasses, the color of the United, damn it, Nations? Lately they're completely chickening out. Gotta call in the whole regiment along with the airforce for protection just to take a few steps off the base.
And what's it to you? Don't bother them with stupid questions, and then they'll leave you alone as well.

You see, we usually don't leave the bunker without the necessary protection: the conditions of the surrounding territory don't permit it. I'm a sort of an exception - don't really like large expeditions, all this fuss, soldiers...But in any case, I'm afraid I can't tell you anything helpful for the time being.
I get a kick out of our happy science! I just totally dig it, man.

It's already the third day that I'm hanging out here, observing. There's an underground here, right? Nobody's gone in it and survived. Dutiers used to purge zombies only on top, and now stopped completely, right? But scientists had to go in there. That means they found a way to protect themselves, the devil knows from what. So I'm thinking, why not snoop around, find out - I bet there are so many goodies there.

In the last few days whole packs of animals are coming out of the Dark Valley. What's forcing them out of there is unclear, but they're really pushing out of there, as if from a fire. And in the eastern sector the mutants are breeding like flies. All we can do is keep shooting them down. So that's the news.
And what are you looking for here? Also going treasure hunting in the dark caverns? Did you hear a fairy tale about magical instruments and piles of artifacts? Man...when will you idiots ever learn?

I work here, young man. Simply work here, carrying out my duty before science and humanity. And if you wish you find out more about the underground, the same thing that every stalker I meet thinks I know, I will tell you: I don't know and don't want to know. This topic doesn't interest me and never interested me, is that clear?!
Maybe the brains really did come up with some sort of instrument? I wonder what's hidden in that damned place. Even if there aren't any goodies there - still it's interesting.

I'm wondering - maybe I should join Freedom? There's their base, in the Outskirts. And why not? Seem like pretty smart guys, and so what if they're a bit disorganized? It's even better that way: I don't need to be disciplined, I know what I'm supposed to be doing - not like this is my first month here.

You're not too friendly with Freedom, are you? Fine, fine, don't get all upset. They don't have any organization nor any discipline - a big herd. A pack at best. And they dare stand up against us, those NATO fledglings.

I meet up with one of the Duty men when there was a cease-fire. The man's actually smart, but, shit, narrow-minded like a tank. You see, our philosophy is completely different from theirs: you can only tame the Zone, assimilate it, but not destroy it. To do it we need open access to all of the information: someone will come up with something eventually. But they're all about "close it" and "lock it" and "don't spread it around"...Retards, complete retards. On the other hand, it makes sense: when the whole political machine is behind you, you're not supposed to think outside of the box.
There's a little cottage here, used to be calm but now there are some creeps breeding here. Better go around, I am...dont say I never warned you!
I want to warn you, stalker, right away: the bloodsuckers have long since made a nest in the village, and maybe something worse, so be careful.

There's nothing new. There are no more artifacts here, and bloodsuckers used to live in the little cottages, we shot them off best as we could. Now I went, and can't get to the place. Intuition, maybe, but I can't and that's it. No way. There is death there...

I'm getting the hell out of here! Bummed around for four weeks on the border, and that's it - enough out of me! Freaks are constantly coming over here from the direction of the Scorcher, and each day more and more of them...

Now many have become "trashmen". Before they didn't used to even look in the piles - such high radiation that it'll hard-boil eggs for you in half an hour. And now that it's gotten harder with the goodies, they'll wrap themselves in protection, take some chemicals, and climb in to look. There's all sorts of stuff that comes up there, though usually it's little junk.
If you're coming here, to join our blockade, I respect you. If not - get the hell out of my sight! We need real men and not sissies: got enough of those already...

You're here for the blockade? All the better - at least one more normal person will be here. We organized this thing and held it together pretty well...but then all the beasts had to come our way!...Now it's tough and every barrel counts.

Aren't you up to date? The way to the center of the Zone has been opened! Either it opened on its own or someone tried really hard - if so thanks to them whole-heartedly. Now all you have to do it gather the finest goods!

You might have waited, stalker. Don't run after everything. Just tell me: do you know what's over there? That's right, you don't know. Don't know whether there's anything there or not. What kinds of traps await you, you don't know either. Then why the hell are you trying to break through like a herd of buffalo?

The way to the center is free, understand?! Now there's a straight path right to the center! Now everyone is gonna haul over there. What's important is to be among the first, the gather the firstfruit!

Keep on trucking ahead - you'll see everything yourself! Don't you want to see for yourself what's going on ahead? Well then you're totally...blessed. There must be so many goods there! For example, you heard about the Granter of Wishes, right?
Just like children, for goodness sake! "Wish Granter", "Klondike of Artifacts"...can't believe my ears!
I want to find out myself what's beyond the horizon, man! What if we'll be able to find out, in one blow, all the explanations for why the Zone is the way it is?
Did you see the skyscrapers? That's already Pripyat. The station is right behind it. Oh how I wish to get in there...just that it's hard to tell what's roaming in there nowadays.
Let me explain. There's Pripyat. Behind it - Chernobyl NPP. What's going on there and who's inhabiting these parts, is unknown. This is the place for us. We'll find something, as usual.

Not up to date! And I'm just heading towards the bar, to chat with folks. What, you've never been there? Goodness! So here's the deal: the way you're standing, just keep on moving north. The bar's just around the corner. It's very helpful to drop by there, especially for newbies like you it's like prescribed by the doctor: there are experienced men there, who knows, they may help out, tell you something, how and what. One thing, you'll run into our buddies from the Duty on the way...and here it depends - if you're lucky, they'll like you. If not, well then they won't.
Pripyat! Pinch me damn it! Finally! From here it's just a ways away to the station. Damn, hard to know though who you can run into here - what critter is sharpening its teeth waiting for you.
Listen, friend...Are you also hearing a voice in your head, or am I hallucinating? Keeps on murmuring something over and over again...

Damn, another one...So here's the deal. I'll try to explain for the billionth time what kind of telepathic effect people here experience. Voices not heard from the outside are constantly calling them towards the center of the Zone promising to grant every wish for the one who is able to touch...what's it called?...Oh yeah, some monolith.
Do you hear a voice? Cool, just like a player in your head! Shame there's only one track though: come to me and you'll have great happiness. Two hours harping on the same thing.
And you can't guess what it is? You're trying to break through to the station yourself too! Well and so are we - what else is new?! Just as long as we can get these retards off the road...
The territory of the station is very close! For now we still can't deal with the resistance of the monolithians!
There it is, Chernobyl NPP, within arms' reach. Just a bit left, but these damned bitches are so stubborn, won't let us through! No big deal, we'll clear them out in no time!

Listen, friend, you don't know about the Agroprom? I wanted to go there, but everyone started mocking me: there aren't any goods there anymore, they cleaned the place a while ago, and now only anomalies left. Do you know, are they serious or are they just saying that to joke around? I'm pretty new here - believe what the locals say...Maybe they're all together in on it, just to mess around? All they need is a reason to laugh their heads off, these jerks!
Wait! More haste, less hurry. There are monolithians all around, they know the city through and through, put up lots of traps. Need to be careful.

I'm warning you: for now a large portion of the city is controlled by the Monolith faction. Lots of traps - they know the city like the back of their hand. Keep a sharp eye out and check your weapons.
Oh, what I would gladly do is cover the city with a bomb carpet. Swine...the only place they're not hiding is in sand boxes and flower pots. How many people have already died because of these creeps!

Listen, who knows this Granter...maybe it's not eternal, so there won't be enough for everybody? And what's one to do? Get down on all fours? And you, dude, I promise you this: if we get there, you're going after me...

Duty has to break through to the center, if not first then one of the first! Just imagine, stalker, that some psycho - and all of you here are either physics, paranoics and oligophrens - gets to the thing that really can grant any wish, huh? And then what?

News of the century: everyone who can walk and carry a weapon is here now! Anything can happen here! You just get it into your head: Anything that you wish! And then someone'll come along and say "I want for the Zone to disappear from now on and forever more". Huh? Do you grasp the dimensions of the tragedy? We're all going to end up in the middle of nowhere, all of us!

Something new? To hell with your new, when there's so much old shit that you couldn't scoop it out with a ladle. The bandits went mad, the swine! We tread between the anomalies trying to get the artifacts, and they're the ones stealing other people's goods...Asses! Just watch out and don't wander into the Garbage - that's exactly their kind of place.

I'm stuck here, you got it, stuck. I want to go home, and they're not letting me. That's all the news. The guys that walk deep into the Zone, the ones that have been around, they say different things. And at times they bring the goodies too - you'd get jealous. They say that there are places like mounds of gold: all for the taking. Granted, not many will get there, and even less will make it back with the finds.

A week ago Vandr burned out at the Scorcher. It'd make sense if it was some yellow-bellied rookie - but he's been a stalker many years. They say he was even on Strelok's team. And then all of a sudden...

You tell me this, stalker: why do you loners sometimes go nuts? Do you lack some basic discipline? The other week one decided to go past the Scorcher. And they say he was experienced too...There's an easier way to get rid of your brains - barrel in the mouth and fire away!
Screw these mercs. They've been drinking our blood for a long time, and now they've turned on the eggheads too. And why did they give in? Because of some ransom? Or to share their Nobel prizes?

Lately the mercs have become much more active. We also call them marauders. There's another kind of swine here, don't know if you heard. Kind of like bandits, except experts in the ways of war. Strange thing, they used to prefer to attack stalkers, but as of late have become more interested in scientists. But you look out in any case, I wouldn't put it past them to shoot your head off either.
Heard a rumor that the eggheads dug up something awesome. And suddenly everybody went nuts: the troops and the mercs, and even the Duty guys aren't far behind.

If you want to know about the same thing that everyone's been bugging me about for the last two days, then I'm telling you: go and take a bath! If I knew and they didn't forbid me, I would have told. But as it stands, I don't know - don't know shit! What did those scientists find? Where did our leadership go? What do I have to do with any of it?! They're off for vacation, and don't have to answer to us and explain themselves.

Ha! Everybody's gone nuts around here! The Confederate with his group have returned from a raid, dragged a bunch of artifacts in - mama mia! Of course Confederate is silent - don't utter a word, as usual - and all of his guys are joking around as if they went up to the Yukon and struck gold...the swine!

Freedom and Duty have agreed to abide by a simple rule: No all-out war for now. If we thin out our numbers just to fight between ourselves, the mercs, bandits and mutants will get the drop on us. Both the General and Lukash understand than that would be bad news for everyone.
The merc threat is growing. With them and major bandit clans huddling together, they're a serious threat to us. I wonder what they might be planning with the new toys they've acquired...

I don't like the Military asses being this close to us. They say the Yantar outpost is to protect the eggheads... What a load of crap! It's clearly a forward operating base. But Voronin isn't worried about it. I guess it's true that if they did anything big, stalkers and Freedom would kick their tush outta here.

Yeah, it is kind of sad, after all. Just the other day Otter died, absolutely for nothing. Just can't believe it...and you haven't ever heard about Otter, have you? Well, he was practically a professor - here from the very first year, he knew the Zone like the back of his hand...and then like that out of the blue! There are some real experienced stalkers out there, but the Zone still takes them. There are others who end up going back to the Big Land.
Wanna know something good? Apparently, the Army has planted agents within certain stalker communities. They'll say they aren't, but believe me, they are.
Something strange is going on. The zombies that used to be afraid to go into the light are now trudging around all over the place. What the hell is that all about?!

The Colonel is getting inpatient about catching the Dark Stalkers. They've fooled us at every turn, but we're closing in on them - slowly but surely. They won't find it funny when we find their hideout.

Well, we're starting to reconsider whether we should move our primary base to the Rostok Factory. The beasts there are a growing threat. We've managed to keep them at bay, but one day they'll break us. Thinking we can overcome their numbers by willpower will be our downfall.
Monolithian activity up North has increased twofold since last month. Even with everyone going against them, they still hold the line. The Scorcher doesn't help the situation one bit.
Rumors are going around that the scientists hired one of ours to go down to the lab. Gave him something...some sort of protective gear...and nothing else, and no more details.
They blab all sorts of things. They even say that some nut turned up who talked with a scientist and agreed to go down to the lab for them for some reason. Now thats a load of crap!
And here's the big joke of the week! The eggheads gave one of your guys a pretty good grant, and so he climbed into the lab with one of their instruments. Another victim, dammit!
I think something's brewing again. The eggheads dug something up that has everyone standing on their ears, which means that you and I won't have any peace either.
The devil knows. Just started hustling us around twice as much as before - either a blockade, or a purge...and there is a significant increase in troop numbers in the Zone as well.

It's all sad, that much I know. There's always been lots of people on the periphery, but half of them have never been deep into the Zone and there aren't enough artifacts for everyone. They even tore out and took away everything that they could from the labratories and factories. Soon there won't be anything left to do here but open a restaurant...with an exotic view and cuisine.

I don't even know what to tell you...There's always something going on here, but within the bounds of reason. Although they don't think so on the Big Land, but you and I are, so to speak, in an anomalous zone now.

The eggheads are sniffing something out. Hell knows what secret they've already stumbled upon, but they're certainly got the troops wrapped around their little finger. And they are searching all over the Agroprom and the Dark Valley already, searching, searching, trying to find something...

With every day there's more and more crap coming out of the Scorcher, and the guys from Duty and Freedom decided to bitch around again. They'll kill each other off, and then what? How long can we hold the border all by ourselves?
The mutants are trying harder and harder to get past the barrier. Lately it's been really hard. If some people put an end to their retarded ways, we would have more success!

The Duty keeps on screaming about their super-heroic deeds on the barrier. If only someone believed them...We began this deal, and we're the ones that keep it going, and on top of that many of the loners like yourself willingly stayed behind. But those guys from the Duty....the assess..to hell with them!

I heard that Duty has totally sold out. They keep on saying something like "we're all volunteers who want to establish safety and order in the Zone"...yeah right, volunteers! Some sponsor gave these so-called volunteers so much ammo, such barrels, that you'd die from envy. And so they sold out.
What rumors are going around? I'll tell you without any rumors: soon there'll be more order. We'll purge the Zone from all sorts of beasts, and from certain asses too...

Did you hear what the guys from Duty are saying they'll do to us? "Turn them to dust" - and that's just the bare minimum. This whole thing worries me...Especially since, people say, they've rearmed themselves with state-of-the-art equipment.

What news? We sit here, the animals come at us, we shoot them off, then they come again, only stronger. Granted, a few times the military choppers came by, and it seems they flew even past the Scorcher.
What news can there be...same old, same old. Mutants, Freedom...although recently soldiers started flying by. At least they could have shot at a beast once...but no, none of that...

News? Who cares what they say! You can't believe everything everyone says. For example, they say that some experienced stalker came from the inner areas, brought something nobody's ever seen before, impressed a ton of chicks...Well I can make up a hundred stories like that myself!

I saw some military choppers: imagine this, they flew overhead and headed past the Brain Scorcher! Well, I'm thinking, they're gonna crash now. But nothing - they just keep on going. Hung out there for a while, twirled around, and then headed back. Typical, right?
Oh now that there's a way to the center - there must be so much treasure lying right under your feet!
Now that there are ways of getting to the center of the Zone relatively safely, stalkers are drawn to it like flies to honey. Yeah...greed really isn't humanity's greatest quality.

Now this is the life! While all those from the bar and the perimeter are still trying to get here, we'll get all the best stuff! We'll gather all the best goodies, and let the others pick up the little junk after us.
Well they say that it actually exists - the Granter of wishes. Somebody even managed to get to it already, and to wish a whole ton of wishes...

Listen, buddy, I know that anything can happen in the Zone. Saw it myself. But these stories about the immediate granting of wishes about a private hotel on the Carribeans - is complete bullshit and nothing else.

Don't you know? Two of our guys - some of the very first who made it to the center - actually got to the Granter of wishes and wished! Their whole life they dreamed about islands in a warm sea, so now they must be sunbathing somewhere in the tropics.
We found a hero - the main guy from Freedom. Everyone thought that he went back to the Big Land, but actually he took a small team and somehow made it past the scorcher. Now there's a man.

In the formerly inaccessible zone one of the Freedom detachments was discovered. How did they manage to get through unharmed and then survive a few weeks here? Can't even imagine. I guess we underestimated these guys.
Imagine this - they found our Mikluha! And the guys that were with him also survived. They sneaked past the braineraser, and then spent a month just killing time, couldn't get back out.

There's something sticky brewing. Rumors are going around that the leader of the Duty faction, the head honcho, didn't just leave the Zone on business, but made a deal with the Freedom faction. Well they could have made the same deal in the open, because now everything's a muddle. Things don't look good. On the other hand, the experienced guys say that they started fighting back in the day for no good reason. Just hope the cabinet freaks from the Big Land don't drag us all into another meat grinder
You heard?! The troops will be here soon! They found out that the scorcher broke down, and decided to take all the goods for themselves!..
New information has just come in: there's going to be a massive-scale landing of army troops at the station. My advice for you is this: if you want to snag at least a bit of the goodies, hurry.

It's a complete chaos, that's what it is! But you see, the corridor has opened, they purged the station from all kinds of shit - and there you have it, the military is ready to take advantage of it! No shame and no conscience.
I don't get one thing: how could the members of the Freedom faction hold out for a month here? Do they have invisible cloaks or something? There's no way!
Did you understand what's going on here? Well I just gained new respect for Mikluha! Imagine - to survive four weeks in this shit, and not to lose any of your guys either!
Some of them went crazy. And to think, they all used to be pretty tough guys, but now are slobering like the biggest retards. Scary.

The closer you get to the station, the stronger the unknown telepathic force becomes. Some have started going insane, others are traumatized and are seeing things. Maybe this is a good time to retreat a bit..

Listen, people here are really losing their minds. Somebody sees a stone and begins hollering that it is his damned artifact, that he saw it first, and that everyone should go south. Another one sees Dja on a cloud embracing his buddies who disappeared years ago...No, there's definitely some sick shit going on here.

I wonder where we get the fuel for all these helicopters we are flying around. I mean last time I heard our budget for this operation wasn't that high... or maybe it is now with all that is goin' on. But still...

I was drunk once with my senior officer, he told me he went into the zone undercover and found an abandoned secret lab where they were developing some amazing new weapon tech. Some rifle that can shoot anything at almost unlimited distance, no ballistic curve... Damn gun like that would be really useful here.
Guys from northern outposts were talking about some mutant that can stomp so hard that it sits you on your ass. I wonder how many bullets it can withstand before I sit it on it's ass...
Don't look the boss in the eyes for too long, he takes it as provocation. The last guy that tried it was gutted right where he stood ... just a little advice...

Zombies are awesome for practicing hand to hand combat... punching bags that keep getting up.. and if you break it's arm, you get a new zombie and the broken one can be still useful for target practice... one has to be economical here!

Our Chief once fended off a chimera that attacked him with nothing but a knife. That beast ambushed his former unit, killed everyone and he was only one who survived... But for all I know, it could be him alone who killed all of them with that knife, and made up this story as a cover. He certainly is capable of that...
My friend promised that he will smuggle a flamethrower here. It would be really badass to just storm some camps with that thing!

Some Monolith dude once bought a large bag of weed from me. He said it is for the enhanced meditation. I heard those guys can go in to deep trance state, communicating with some higher power. That's pretty wicked man, They are still freaks though...
One night I saw dwarfs running around in dark valley. I know right? Dwarfs, freaking little people... It was crazy I'm still not sure if I really saw them or it was that crack I had earlier.

From time to time I see some graffiti here and there. We are all about freedom here, as you can see, but that shit? If I caught some punk disgracing this place, I would fucking break his knees... It is like pissing on the graves of our fathers and mothers. No respect. I don't like that... not even bandits spray graffiti here for fuck sake...
We have tolerated you here so far, but that doesn't necessarily mean that we are friends with you...
I have been here a long time. The things that I've seen, things that I've experienced, I would not wish on my worst enemy.
It is in our mutual interests if you keep our location to yourself...
The Zone probably has its own mind. We are it's play things. It is just a new enormous living organism...
I was trying to help humanity... now look at what's left here...nothing but human wreckage unable to help anyone ... not even himself...

I first came here as a scavenger looking for something I can sell for a lot of money to save my wife...pay for her treatment.... it was a desperate move. Some guys earned a lot of cash bringing back incredible things, so I thought....that I could save her.... I should have stayed at home with her. When I finally made it back, she was gone, strangely a lot of time had passed. I had no idea... then I had nothing else left to live for, so I returned here...trying to make a difference at least by saving lives here. And if I die, maybe I will see her again.
Watch out man... there is lot of backstabbers around here.
When I make enough money, I'm gonna start my own liquor company, and I'm gonna make it right here in some old building. It will be awesome, King of the street.
Where is all the gold and money that they promised us? I was expecting diamond covered luxury cars, golden guns and bitches. But this, this is just endless hard work all the way. This sucks man.
I once slept with twin sisters and it was awesome, only it was in a dream because there are no freaking chicks around here god dammit !
Man you are ugly, can't you wear a gas mask or something? Jeez, a face like flash. I bet you are still a virgin.

You know what this place needs? A brothel. Once I get out of here I'm gonna pick up some girls and bring them right back here and I'm gonna make millions. You'll see, I show you all who's the boss and who is the bitch!
These military assholes think they own the place... me and my buddy are collecting money for RPG to shoot down one of them choppers, that will teach them a lesson...
Don't smoke man. It attracts bloodsuckers...I don't know why, some say they love the smell, others say the blood tastes better. Who knows, just a piece of advice.

One has to enjoy the little things, you know? Just to be able to sit in the grass.... sun shining on your face, opening the can that isn't actually spoiled inside, to smell it... mmm it smells good... having a sleeping bag with no holes in it...a place to cover your head when is raining. It's the little things man....that make me go on... little things like that...

That campfire in our camp, it just keeps burning and burning, it's like two weeks in a row man.... and I have barely seen anyone throwing any wood in it... it's so strange.....there must be some artefact on the bottom of it or something... Or I'm just losing my mind...

Hey! You are that guy who survived the death truck ...Man let me have look at you... Mhh well you are either some kind of superhero, or somebody upstairs has a soft spot for you. I hope it's not bad luck to talk to you...

I came here as a bird watcher. I used to observe birds. I love them, and there are some pretty interesting crows here. I never got back out though. Bandits stole my camera a long time ago. And now my favorite crows are circling above my head like a pack of vultures. Watching me instead. Waiting for me to finally die so they can eat me... This place has a strange sense of humor
Once bandits finish plundering the garbage, they will surely start on construction site. They always hang out at every place that seems to have some junk laying around.
I have seen endless fractals of information from which this universe consists. I travelled out of my body to different realms. The monolith showed me the way. I now understand...

I once saw a mighty monolith in the middle of a deep forest casting a long shadow and he smite down, by thunder, everyone and everything, beast and man as equals who dare to reach him, but it is a false monolith, a false prophet. I believe I had this vision to test my faith.
Being Monolith is in a way like being ancient samurai. We have our code of honor, discipline, we keep humble, we train hard and we have a master Monolith.

During meditation once, I reached a strange being with my mind. It had a powerful mind! It told me "I was once as you are..." and then contact was broken. Later I realized it was a controller. Controllers used to be human? That is interesting indeed.

Have you ever wondered why you never see anyone roast their kalbasa on a stick like we used to do as kids? I heard it's because there is something weird in the trees some strange substance it gives you nasty diarrhea if you roast food like that in an open campfire. We used to do this to annoying rookies, "Hey make yourself a roasted kalbasa man" those were the days...
Days fly along over here, but as they say: "Time flies when you having fun" .... I guess, But still it feels bit strange

I heard that some dude made it out of the zone and he patented some new technology, something called plug or something similar. They say it is based on a small artefact that he is using as power source for engines. He made a few prototype cars already and is about to get disgustingly rich. I hope I make a move like that in the future...

When you see one blind dog or pseudo dog, run, there are more on the way in that instance. Blind ones may not see you but they have different means to very precisely know where you are. And pseudo dogs... I heard some heavily mutated ones can even cause you to hallucinate, so definitely not a pet.

I don't remember how I got here man. Can you believe this? I just went to sleep one day in my flat in Odessa and woke up in the attic of one the abandoned buildings at cordon. Having nothing on me but my t-shirt and boxers. First I thought this is some weird nightmare or some joke, and later on I even thought it was some kind of stupid reality show, but after two years I highly doubt any of that. Maybe I just died there that night at my bed and this is what hell looks like. One of my ex's cursed me, she said to go to hell ....anything is possible.

I think the Zone is little demo of what it would be like if the world ended.... I mean not ended, but like civilization ended, system collapsed.... if people got mostly extinct.... I think this is how it would look like.... except for anomalies and bloodsuckers and radiation and zombies and artefacts... and there would be some girls around....I think.

Now just what in the hell is a Night Star? I mean really ? I swear Barkeep must making up those freaking names ... Next time he will send me for moon dust or something. But then again... he offers good money for it.

I often think about all the radiation that we don't know about ... I mean there is still hundreds of tons of highly irradiated junk everywhere and it will be that way for another 250 000 years. And every rain washes away tiny bits into the soil... and if it's in the soil then it is for sure in the ground water. And if it is in ground water, than it is in Pripyat river and from there in Dnijepr and then all the way to the Black sea... So this place will be leaking radioactive shit in the whole planet for another quarter million years. And now we have another layer of problems with the zone and everything.
I heard a rumor about some cars still being functional here. Do little tweak here and there and you can drive yourself around. Man that would make things easier I can tell you that...
Well I'm not really up to date with all the latest news.

I believe that technological singularity is very near now. And with discoveries such are these we are making here, humanity will fuse with technology and become one with it inevitably. New evolutionary step! It will be brilliant! It isn't a question of "if" but rather "when".

In this particular location, there are ideal conditions for observing the night sky due to the lack of lights. Shame we are not equipped for such observations, nor are heavenly bodies our point of interest during this task.

I have several brilliant ideas that once I finish my research here, I'm sure I will be able to win Nobel peace prize for. But I can't tell you what ideas. But I shall have to hurry a bit, I heard that 3D printing was already invented. Time runs so fast...
Something amazing is happening even as we speak, my friend, let's better not delay one another further.

As a little boy, I used to live in Pripyat with my mother and my brother. Only a long time after we were evacuated did I learn the whole truth about how serious the situation was in fact. I was never to return. But then the whole second explosion occurred, I felt an opportunity for me to return home in a way. Long before duty was formed I made it to the zone, I didn't care about all the interesting things others were pulling out. I only wanted to see my old room again, and smell the kitchen. Ride my bike... When I arrived there finally, I saw the tormented remains of my childhood. I just dropped to my knees and cried, it was hard ,this place stole my life and forced me into another very different one...
When I joined, I was hungry for some action. But now ... Now I'm glad when there is nothing happening for few hours... With all the shit going on, one has to be grateful.

We recently discovered some very interesting properties of several artefacts. One, for example, has a very interesting molecular structure such that it could, in future, replace most commonly used plastic. This discovery could not only help our economy, but even help clean this planet of our outdated oil related resources.

The environmental suit that we are using is made from a special material that is that is sewn together using a high frequency sonic beam. This special technology prevents micro or even nanoparticles to get in.
I hope I don't have to be the one to lube the gearbox on our windmill... My tolerance for heights is very low. I'm a scientist not an engineer damnit!

We humans are being very arrogant, silly even, if we think of ourselves as the peak of evolution. The very best that universe was able to produce...We are nothing but a thin layer on the surface of a gigantic and perhaps even living object, we call earth. And every day here in the zone I'm reminded of our arrogance...
Sometimes when I'm conducting experiments, I wonder if we perhaps aren't test subjects ourselves. In some bizarre maze, constructed by who knows what. I certainly feel like that more often than not.

First firemen that arrived to the reactor back in 86 were oblivious to the actual severity of the situation... They went there with no protection against radiation whatsoever. Actually a lot of people sacrificed their lives without protection to save not only the near vicinity, but the whole of Europe... the whole world perhaps. It was humanity versus radiation. In my opinion, the greatest war in human history... that had the greatest heroes.

Our recent observations have shown that there are no deep waters in the Zone. Although it rains quite regularly and the pits and ditches are a plenty. I've have an idea, not too scientific an idea. It seems to me, the Earth itself doesn't wanna hold that much filth on the surface. As if it feels that keeping the muck in, is it's duty, and takes the blow itself.

Not really much to tell. Have you ever met a zombie here? I have, eerie stuff. Especially if he was your partner, or friend... You talked to a guy, you knew him well, shared your shelter and food with him, fought back mutants side by side, shat bricks while being shot at... and then he suddenly he disappears. Then one day you spot someone in the distance, dragging his feet, scraping the ground with his shooter... You take your binoculars, and there he is, your old mate, only not quite himself - his eyes rolled up, mouth fallen open as if he's a fly catcher... and you don't know whether you should finish him off or protect him from guys like yourself... the "well-wishers".

A funny story: when I was a rookie, I went exploring in an old house not far away from here. As I was sniffing around in there, I heard a faint sound behind me... like a voice! It sounded annoyed and almost human. I froze and then slowly turned my head and my flashlight rested on something, like a little midget person and it was looking right back at me. I was terrified! I didn't know what to expect and then it made that clearly upset sound again and charged me! I screamed like a little girl and ran as fast as I could, being chased by this little angry person on its little tiny legs....It must have looked hilarious!

World war machinery is quickly forgetting the power of the atom. Keeping nuclear weapons in the arsenal of any army is foolish. And it is a big hazard for all life on the earth. Nuclear test explosions as well. Damn fools.

Don't mind the others... It is very hard for us here. The things we have been through. The experiments, the pain....Many of us died or went mad or even mutated into nightmarish existences. It is mostly nothing personal.

Take your things and run out of the zone as fast as you can. You still have life ahead of you. Go enjoy your life while there is still someone waiting for you outside of zone and while an "outside of the zone" still exists!
Sometimes I wonder why the zone kept me alive all that time. I remember very different times. I came here to help the world...
What are you people doing here anyway? All of you keep pouring into the zone like this is some kind of gold mine. Don't you treasure your life?
We have been hunted by the military like animals in the old days. Before all this. Before stalkers, outposts, looting... I remember an entirely different zone.
In time, one can get use to the pain. Now when I wake up and nothing hurts, I even wonder if I'm dead.
Keep your nose out of our business and we will keep your nose on your face...
If I drink lots of water......it ..... gets better....... I need more water. COUGH
You look familiar... I remember someone like you... better equipped though...
Be careful smooth face. You don't wanna piss any of us off. Trust me!
What are you looking at? Never seen a walking corpse before?

Hey I'm really glad that the eggheads are using people like you for their crazy assignments. I mean, we are here just to cover their asses if anything bad happens, not as their minions. I certainly would not want my brain boiled. Just gonna guard this post, and you? You they can dissect alive or whatever, as long as it is not me, I don't care ...

We requested dogs here for patrols, and you know what headquarters said "domesticate local fauna" those jerks... last time we tried to train a pseudodog was 5 months ago. I have scars as if from a shark on my hip...
I shouldn't be talking to you stalker move a long...

We have snipers all over the place, ready to take a shot at you. Did you know that?... Now kiss my boots... No? Guys we have a hero... Graveyards are full of heroes, you should remember that... Move along, I'm just pulling your leg Stalker.

Oh yeah. Before I joined duty, I was a loner, having nothing much to do, except for some random scavenging, I was mostly in cordon. And then one guy came along, with shiny new armor and a large gun and he told me if I have balls I should join duty and I will find purpose! He told me to get to the bar if I wanna know more. So that's how I got recruited... getting there was test on it's own. But here I am...

Once, my friend had gone missing. Rescue mission was out of the question. So I geared up, pressed on my own contacts, and by the evening, I had a pretty good vantage point above the bandit camp. Having my silenced sniper rifle cleaned and ready... It was perfect...silenced shots and noises of dead bodies falling into the mud. I was taking them down headshot after headshot, until there was only one left... He didn't even know that all the others were dead when I drove a knife through his kidney. It was horrific and exciting at the same time...

The Zone exhibits unknown permanent time distortion of spherical geometry. We measured that time moves a lot slower inside this spherical area relative to the rest of the universe, making it seem that sun drift faster then outside, so days and nights are shorter for us. To keep track of time outside we make compensating modifications to PDAs before they are handed over to stalkers and military personal, so their clocks are showing time that is consistent with time outside, it "ticks" faster. All this is of course kept secret from the public...

We are constantly updating and uploading our latest finds in to the PDA network... Yes we have improvised local BTS network. Check out encyclopedia here and there for news. We are making quite an effort actually, to keep locals up to date. You guys are calling us eggheads, but thanks to us you have these PDAs packed with useful data as well as smart social networking...Little appreciation from time to time would be nice...

When the second blowout occurred, my first thoughts were that we are doomed... that the so feared second explosion somehow went on. Due, perhaps, to underground water getting in contact with the still burning core, being much hotter than we expected... I was somewhat relieved when news arrived about the epicenter being more to the north away from the power plant. But immediately a new question arose ! What the hell happened this time with such strange and strong readings?

From time to time, we receive messages from a variety of sources stating that zombies have a higher resistance to gunfire. By having collated these bits of information with the gunfire injuries data accumulated by humanity over its history, we can say that such a surmise wrong. The sole difference between a zombie versus a normal human would be the absence of pain shock. It would be of interest to research a specimen of these... altered humans in laboratory conditions While they are alive, so to speak...

You know, some of my colleagues and I originated a certain hypothesis regarding the things we observe here. We see the Zone to be, most probably, a living organism. Anomalies serve as something resembling our digestive system. Though it is an open-type system, scattered all around. The artifacts are respectively the waste products of the Zone, so to speak. Now, what are the blowouts? Probably they are stresses experienced by the Zone. Regeneration, maybe? Because as you may know, these 'organs' relocate. But what causes the blowout? For this kind of question, we don't even have a hypothesis.

Attitudes towards the phenomenon of the Zone can differ, but there is still one undeniable merit. These are technologies created or advanced on the basis of local observations or materials. For example, the Gauss gun widely known to a small audience has gained a new lease on life and upgraded to unbelievable power due to the anomalous materials. Excuse the sad pun and the grim prediction, but this lease on life would definitely turn into death for many as soon as it falls into the "wrong hands". Same as the case is with most inventions, everything depends on the hands it falls into.

Any artifacts you find are of great value for science. It's not a secret that they possess useful properties, which is a logical consequence of their origin, but this is not a matter to discuss right now. Some of the products of the Zone can have low-grade or solely negative properties only, if any at all. Please don't get disappointed, it does not in any way diminish their value for science. So whatever you find, bring it to an ecologist. I personally am not in favour of the attempts by the Duty faction to monopolize artifacts. What do they do with them anyhow? I't's unclear, but any procrastination in studying them could cost somebody their life.

I came back from a raid recently. I saw two stalkers, through my binoculars, loot-loaded up to their eyeballs and they made a stop for the night. While one of them was asleep, the second one took a rope out of his backpack and started tying the first one up. He grinned at his tied-up pal and the second he got under the load of both backpacks, he looked stunned. He slowly turned around and started walking, dragging his feet into the darkness. After an hour or two, rats or tushkanos came and chewed through the first guy's ropes. As soon as he came to his senses, he got the hell out of there. After a bit of investigating, we saw where the first one had been "called" by a controller. He was hungry, he didn't cared the loot. If the second one wasn't tied up, he would've gone the same way. Justice was served, one could say.

If you ever get into the local laboratories, pay attention to their doors. People used to be skillful in door making before! Only a code will open those, no weapon will do the job... except maybe the Gauss rifle. But to find this baby would be a miracle! And they say the charges it uses are worth their weight in gold. Duty wouldn't mind to have such a piece in our armoury.

Ever met any zombies here? When you see one, tame your itch to shoot. Figure out if the guy is a controller's puppet, then find the controller and eliminate him. The poor bastard may be lucky and make it back if his willpower is strong enough. There are too many gunslingers here you know... the trigger-happy ones...

I suggested many times that we need snipers on these roofs... THere is a lot of ground to cover here and having lookout positions is crucial. It's only a matter of time before someone sneaks up on us...

Is patrolling or guarding interesting, ha? What do you think? I'd rather be hunting artifacts or on a mission. Anything is more interesting than keeping company with these dumbasses... I talk too much. Ok, move along!

Whenever you come to Garbage, take a look at the waste piles between the hangar and the road to Agroprom, and between the ruined building on the South and the railway line. I'm itching to dig into those! The only trouble is my counter crackles there as if it's a damn pseudo-cricket, you can't approach just like that. It doesn't matter though, I'll save some for proper protection and I'll get through. And I'll have my diggin' to see if there is anything valuable there. If there's anything left...

I noticed something strange thing here. The junk piles were bigger when I first arrived here. My understanding was that all the scavenging had been done before the second disaster and it stopped because there was nothing valuable left here. But now I walk around some parts and don't see some of the steel structures or other stuff I clearly remembered to have been there, I even used some of them as landmarks for myself... Probably somebody's still getting the contaminated junk out the Zone. Well, we're yet to see who'll be the winner out of all this.

Some of our dudes can tell if a blowout is near. First they watch the mutants and if they start panicking, don't attack and run like hell trying to escape then it's not a good sign. Second, keep an eye on the sky. It would either suddenly get overcast on a sunny day. In any event, what will follow is all the colors of the rainbow, ending with a brilliant red... And what do you do next? Run for your life. Or dig underground, if there's nowhere to run. Or pray.

Though this place is sparsely populated, you can still meet all sorts of different characters. Some of 'em sell every artifact they find without even thinking about using them instead. Some do the opposite, they decorate themselves too much and they use rubbish like tin cans and dog tails... No wonder many people leave the Zone. You see these "shamans" for too long and you start worrying about your own sanity.
Look, I don't have anything against you, but...I...can't talk to you. The guys will never let me live it down, fraternising with the noob.
Dunno what these quakes are all about but they can't be anything good!
You feel the quakes? Yeah, hard not to. Some say it's the zone expanding that causes them...

During one patrol in the dark valley, before all the scum settled down there...We encountered a strange being. It was some sort of disfigured man, even had some tattered clothing on... He looked deep in to my eyes.... and, was almost about to say something to me when our squad leader shot the poor thing down. I still have its face in my mind, with a big "why" question written all over it....Sometimes I wonder if we are the real monsters in this place...

I heard a rumour about some teleporting anomalies. Those would be handy. Being at the bar, getting radioed about needing reinforcements at Rostok factory? BAM you are in rostok. Monolith roaming through the garbage? BAM we're there... We gonna have to press the Eggheads to find them and harvest them!

Why aren't we doing anything? I mean Duty has so many troops! We are the biggest faction in the zone for crying out loud....and yet we are just sitting around, doing nothing. We should be conquering this place, rid it of mutants, kick out squatters and stuff... We should be dragging egg heads to whatever the source of this madness is to put the end to it.

When I was younger, I watched a lot of old Hollywood movies. I always wanted to be a hero macho man, with a big gun, shooting everyone who I did not like. Then I came here. Man was I surprised at the reality of the place. After my first kill I vomited, and I was shaking for one week straight. It's a struggle for survival. One never gets rid of the guilt after that shit.

Dude, we were having a debate about reincarnation. I think that it would be wicked when you get shot you sorta spawn again having another chance to do it all correct this time. Sure you are beginning from zero. That's better than dying and never returning... right?

Is it even moral to shoot down zombies? I mean aren't they still human beings? Well, so may be controllers.... I saw one with pants, and he looked like some injured dude with bandages and everything... shit.

People think we are just a bunch of hippies ... well I tell you one major difference between freedom and hippies! We f'ing shoot back ! It's not all rainbows and ponies here and we are not exactly putting flowers into barrels here...
Where did the mercenaries come from anyway... it used to be only loners, military and eggheads out here. Now it is one freak after another.

When the first blow out appeared, the one which started up this whole mess, there was gigantic earthquake. They say it was stronger than the strongest nuke detonated underground... this place used to be pretty leveled, but now earth is moved, bridges destroyed, tunnels caved in, large wrinkles where ground was flat... it makes it more difficult to travel...

I use to have an awesome bike man... Downhill special. Carbon composite frame, really high forks. I represented Ukraine in downhill riding back than...It cost all I had man.... Seeing the zone, now here would be some great places to ride. Well that was my former life... I don't even know where that bike ended up... Sponsors probably took it.

Me and my brother actually followed our father in here. He was disappearing for months and our Mom was really psyched out about that, so we decided to find out what the big secret is. My little brother thought he is a government agent and I honestly suspected him from having another family with some second wife. Well we arrived here, and now.... both my brother and my father are dead and mom... cut her wrists from grief. I'm the only one left...
You really gotta ask everybody for some stupid news? I mean have you looked around? Does anyone here resemble a tourist guide? Don't answer that! Just leave me alone dude...
Hey how's it going? Nothing much happening around here... Oh yeah, if you see a bandit with a knife in his shoulder ... he owes me money...and a knife...so don't worry about it.

You know the biggest interest in the Zone, in my opinion, is old documents. Any information about what happened from May 1986 until the second disaster. Especially the things that started happening afterwards. Not just your "run of the mill" documents, but the documented data on the reasons why all this shit happened. Only Duty will be able to use this knowledge properly, to help mankind.

I went to Sidorovich once. An old fox he is, I'd pay handsomely to know all his contacts here and on the Main Land. Can you imagine the flow of artifacts he's involved in? Someday, Duty will cap him good. On the other hand, he's helping other stalkers who have the same enemies as we do, and he does remain neutral with the Army who also try to cordon off this infection. But he never forgets his own pocket, does he?

We try to carry out comprehensive studies of the Zone. Our specialists and laboratory technicians are not only working in dusty laboratory facilities, but also carry out field researches. Some of the exposures cannot be registered in laboratory conditions, some "material" is simply unavailable. It happens that the response from the test subjects and from yourself can be noted outside only. I don't have to tell you how important it is to have a set of tools and skills at hand to help you out of a certain situation the best way, or at least survive.

I'm just numb from all the .... death around here.... a week ago a sniper took out my friend ....it was a clean headshot. He crumbled like sack of potatoes right next to me....and I just looked at him... felt absolutely nothing... I wasn't angry, sad nor scared.... I was just tired....

I heard that some mercs are lurking around here.... Little organized squads.... What in hell are they doing here? Is this just a rumour? I mean, I have only heard stories of those death squads... people say they are not stalkers, they are more like dirty guns for hire with their own nasty agenda, If they are even real..... Either way it means more work for us...

Why don't you stalkers tie some string to those bolts you Throw so you can pull them back once the area is clean? Are you afraid of getting pulled in by some nasty anomaly hmm? I guess that make sense.

One sniper tip for you. If you want your bullet to fly straighter, leave magazines out in the sun to get warm. The explosive compound will burn more violently and the materials of the bullet and shell case behave differently so bullets fly faster, therefor further therefor the ballistic curve is straighter.
The order was given to send only soldiers 40 years of age and older to the zone after there were so many young causalities. When HQ realized that the danger is too severe.
That Duty group thinks they are some kind of stalker police... They are just another type of scum. Just leaches and thieves like every single one of you...
In our base we actually had a cook. He made excellent food... and then he got eaten. Heh... cook eaten...that's not even funny. Now we are left with canned shit... again.

The Zone is spreading so fast that nobody has time to move things properly form old outposts to new ones. Waste of resources here is enormous! But it is necessary! We need to contain this! I just hope the eggheads will solve what is causing this soon. And then its game over for you scavengers. We gonna lock this place up watertight and bring an end to this madness.

Funny thing... You can't fool bloodsuckers with camouflage, you can blend into the foliage all you want, but the suckers have heat vision or something and they are invisible themselves. Good thing they don't see land mines. Those saved our asses many times. Well, as the famous quote goes: "if it bleeds you can kill it..."

My brother died by radiation poisoning that he got back in 86. He drove a jeep thought the red forest during his service and got a flat tire. He had to change it right there. Making him spend too much time there. Insignificant thing like a flat tire can cost you your life. The world is twisted...
I told him... never say it's your last day... now he's dead... I fucking told him... Are you having fun ZONE? HUH? you... you! Damn you...

It still gives me the creeps, remembering the northern cities, whole ghost towns... But after all that fear around it, I'm pretty surprised how tenacious nature is in reclaiming the place. Radioactive or not, it is a jungle there....nature doesn't care, it adapts and continues, best armies in the world could learn from that!
I just wanna get back to my wife alive. That's all I care about.

You can join Duty if you want.... I don't know what tests are involved exactly nowadays, but seeing your gear you should be OK. We need people who can take care of themselves. But are you able to follow orders without any questions? Just think about it...

Strange things happening all around... We are quite busy lately. Mutant waves, blowouts, all sorts of weirdo's.... Something is coming man.... We should bunker down and prepare for battle. Not just Duty, but all who want to survive. We have our hands full as it is... who is not with us, needs to fend for themselves.

I had a dilemma for the past few days... I got my shooter all tuned up and then out of the blue I found another one just like mine...only this one was specially upgraded for having less recoil, but mine has a bigger punch because it uses explosive gasses differently when shooting. So what I have to decide is, damage or handling? ... Damn I need both.
Praise the monolith!
Just be a good doggy and do what we say!
The monolith knows all!
Turn to the monolith, it is calling you....
Personally I think the bar here is better than the old 100 rads.
Not much happening, just damn glad I made it out of the old bar alive!
Thanks stalker, you saved our lives!
I can't thank you enough for what you have done for us.
Finally, I can make my own choices again, thank you stalker
Free at last, you're a legend!
Thank you brother, we are free.
Now I can try to return to my family, thank you very much.
Hey marked one, good to see you. Thanks to you we can finally settle here, cheers.
Thank you marked one, it was always our dream to come to this place.
I can't believe we finally made it, than you brother.
For all you have done for us stalkers, we thank you.
We can not thank you enough Strelok, our lives are now complete.
The Ghost group thanks you Strelok!
It's so beautiful here, words can not describe it. I can die in peace. Thank you strelok.

The troops are bustling about - searching, digging. Before, the choppers used to fly only to Yantar - protected the scientists, carried supplies and technology. But now they're practically invading - planning all sorts of expeditions, driving around on APC's. Already saw them on the Agroprom and in the Dark Valley. Don't understand it.

They say that again someone tried to get through the scorcher. Well obviously he never came back...you never heard of the Brain Scorcher? What's wrong with you, man?! It's the biggest danger in this whole area! Only problem is that all the horrors they say about it are mostly true.

Here, besides the bandits, the troops started roaming around for some reason. Before you'd see a helicopter once in a hundred years, but now they're flying around the whole Zone, practically. Did they lose something or what?

I want to warn you, stalker. The soldiers here lately seem to have gone mad. Before they used to calmly and quietly protect the scientists, but now it's as if their tail got burned or something: dashing around, bustling...Not in the most peaceful mood - shot at your brother more than once already, and even among us they've wounded two men in the last week.
Thank you very much.
Thank you very much.

What are you doing, walking around without any protection? Tired of living, is that it? There's an anomaly behind every bush - whack, and you're a gonner! Here they don't even pee without protection, you'll get a dose of radiation in right away.

Seems like you don't know your way around well yet, so I'll warn you as a friend: have nothing to do with the military. Once you spot one, get the hell out of there cuz they have no brains. First they'll put a bullet or ten into you, and then check the documents to see your name.
Here the Duty guys rule. Our dear beloved police force, or something like that. Keep this in mind to avoid trouble.
Good day.
Good day.
I wish you well.
Hey dude!
Hey.
Oh hey!
Hello.
Greetings!
Hello, stalker.
Greetings, stalker.
Make this quick, stalker. I have a schedule to keep!
Hey, stalker!
Hello.
Well who have we got here?!
And who is this we have here?
Why hello, you Duty-ass idiot!
So what exactly do you need here, stalker boy?
Don't you make me angry, lame-ass!
Hey man! You wanna trade?
So are you one of these bandits now?
What do you need here?
Man, are you friends with them bandits now?
Dude, I don't want any trouble! Can we not make one?
Hey, have you lost here? Duty doesn't have any deeds with bandits.
Hey kid, are you with them bandits now? You gotta be crazy...
If you have questions, then head straight for barkeep and don't bother me. He'll tell you all about it here and answer your questions, and ask his own.
First time here? Then I suggest you go to the bar: there your colleagues will tell you all the latest news.
Stalker, this is Duty territory. You will follow our rules to the letter and everything will be gravy - simple as that.
I don't recommend you get too near the underground, I hear there are loads of zombies there...
You know, I would suggest that you keep your distance from the underground.
You watch out for zombies - they're dumb, aren't afraid of anything, they have their breeding grounds there or something...
You keep in mind that the Brain Scorcher is very close. Don't even think about heading north.
Watch out - if you don't want to lose your brains, don't go any further north from here.
Be careful when you get past the bridge, got it? There are too many wondering dogs there. If you don't pay attention, they'll tear you apart in no time.
You look out for yourself! You know that the Scorcher is very close; if you go north, you'll be another dead retard.
It's as if we're walking through a mine field, only worse. The devil knows what goes on in here - can't relax even for a second.
I suggest you heighten your attention, and once you heighten it, keep it alert and don't relax. The minute you relax, you're a gonner - the death will get you on the spot.
Here you have to be on your toes all the time! Sleep with one eye open! Shit can happen to you any minute here.
Be careful with the monos! They're like cockroaches here, tons of them!
Destroy the so-called monolithians as soon as you see them. They're very dangerous - real fanatics!

There are some retards here, they call themselves Monoliths...or someone else started calling them that - well, no matter. Basically, they're not afraid of pain. If they run out of cartridges they jump on you themselves and literally try to gnaw through your throat. So, if you see one, don't think twice about it and fire right away.
You`re not in Kansas anymore Toto so watch yourself!
Keep your distance!
Did you just look at me?
Move along stalker, nothing to see here!
Hey man, speak to our leader, maybe you can help us out.
Stalker, thanks for helping us out, lets get back to it!
Hey Stalker, feel like helping us take out the mono bastards? Speak to our leader over there.
Appreciate the help man. Lets go take out more of the bastards!
Thanks for the help man. We really nailed those mono bastards.
Good job, we`ll hang around here and make sure they don't come back!
This place belongs to duty now!
We did it! I had no doubts we would drive back the mono threat.

Listen here. If you see a tunnel, don't go in. I'm telling it to you straight, cuz not everyone has the brains not to get themselves into shit. They won't even be able to carry you out afterwards - you'll be left splattered in pieces on the walls. That's already the Zone, understand?

Why are you empty? Did you also run into the freaks under the bridge? The bitches! They almost killed me just now. Had to give them almost all of my goods! And they're sitting around, patrolling. Be it bandits, be it these troops on the checkpoints, makes no difference.
Why are you alone? There are lots of razorheads here that can catch you at any moment! Lately, I heard, they completely lost it - now they're even attacking the security checkpoints!

I'm warning you if you're not up-to-date: lately the bandits have been moving around in here. This is already the second shoot-out with them in just a week. Be careful and watch out - they've already sent six loners to the other side.
Did you by any chance hear what the troops needed in the Research Institute wing? Why have they become so active?
You be more careful here. The limitless are hiding out in the main building. In one word, they're jackals - no conscience, no mercy...they would have killed everyone off.
You shouldn't go into the Dark Valley alone. There's a nice tight bandit nest here in one of the buildings - still can't smoke them out of there. Be careful not to run into them, man.
Hello Soldier! Duty clan always welcome you here. Anything you want to discuss?
Hello Sergeant! How are you doing? Duty clan always welcome to you if you wana talk or drink with us.
Hey stalker, join Duty, you never know, it could be your destiny!
Tread lightly around here stalker, this is Duty controlled land!
Hey stalker. Keep it tidy and you'll enjoy your stay.
We could use someone like you in our ranks, speak to the general if you're interested.
Hey brother, good to be alive is it not?
So I bumped into some troublemakers the other day. One had a strange accent, shouting "You'll never take our freedom" or some shit like that, funny.
I heard the general has a man friend, you never heard it from me!
I've heard if you strap three battery artefacts together, it can power an electric toothbrush for 6 months!
Hey marked one, good thing we found you when we did, that was a blowout and a half!
Marked one, good to see you have your colour back.
Hey stalker, you're lucky to be alive! Actually I cant believe you still are!
You look rested, good, you'll be fine.
Hey marked one, good thing we found you when we did, go and speak to Deedee.
Marked one, good to see you have your colour back. Speak to Deedee, he will fill you in.
Hey stalker, you're lucky to be alive! Actually I cant believe you still are! Speak to Deedee if you already haven't.
You look rested, good, you'll be fine. Have a chat with Deedee, he's waiting for you.
Hallowed be the Monolith!
Help friend!
Somebody help!
I'm wounded! Please help!
Help! I'm dying!
Please, help me, I`m wounded!
I'm wounded! Please help!
Help me comrade, I'm wounded!
Help me comrade, I'm wounded!
Help me brother, I'm wounded!
Guys, bring the first aid kit!
Bring the first aid kit!
Anti-shock, guys! Hurry!
The first aid kit, men!
Somebody, give me the first aid kit!
Friend, the first aid kit...the kit!
Help, dude!
Hey friend, can you share your first aid kit, can you?
